content.description: A researcher claims that the synthesis of <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext><mtext></mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> from <math alttext="A D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ADP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and inorganic phosphate <math alttext="P sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext></mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is essential to cellular function.
content.question: Which of the following statements best helps justify the researcherâ€™s claim?

choices.label: <math alttext="A D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ADP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is a small molecule that some cells release into their environment as a way of communicating with other cells.

<math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> hydrolysis is an energy-releasing reaction that is often coupled with reactions that require an input of energy.

Inorganic phosphate <math alttext="P sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext></mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is a substance that cells typically acquire from their environment.

<math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> synthase is a mitochondrial enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of <math alttext="A D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ADP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="P sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext></mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> hydrolysis is an energy-releasing reaction that is often coupled with reactions that require an input of energy.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
